query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
1 Taciti, soli, sanza compagnia 2 n’andavam l’un dinanzi e l’altro dopo, 3 come frati minor vanno per via.
query.result: 1 Silent, alone, without company 2 we went, one before and the other after, 3 as minor friars go along the road.

4 Was turned upon the fable of Aesop 5 my thought for the present quarrel, 6 where he spoke of the frog and the mouse;
7 because it no longer matches “he” and “she” 8 that one with the other does, if well they couple 9 beginning and end with the fixed mind.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
10 E come l’un pensier de l’altro scoppia, 11 così nacque di quello un altro poi, 12 che la prima paura mi fé doppia.
query.result: 10 And as one thought bursts from the other, 11 thus from that was born another then, 12 that the first fear made double for me.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
13 Io pensava così: ‘Questi per noi 14 sono scherniti con danno e con beffa 15 sì fatta, ch’assai credo che lor nòi.
query.result: 13 I was thinking thus: ‘These for us 14 are scorned with harm and with mockery 15 so made, that much I believe they are of our lineage.’

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
16 Se l’ira sovra ’l mal voler s’aggueffa, 17 ei ne verranno dietro più crudeli 18 che ’l cane a quella lievre ch’elli acceffa’.
query.result: 16 If anger upon the bad will rushes, 17 they will come behind more cruel 18 than the dog to that hare which he blinds.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
19 Già mi sentia tutti arricciar li peli 20 de la paura e stava in dietro intento, 21 quand’ io dissi: «Maestro, se non celi
22 te e me tostamente, i’ ho pavento 23 d’i Malebranche. Noi li avem già dietro; 24 io li ’magino sì, che già li sento».
query.result:
19 Already I felt all bristle the hairs 20 of the fear and was standing behind intent, 21 when I said: “Master, if you do not hide
22 you and me quickly, I have fear 23 of the Malebranche. We have them already behind; 24 I imagine them so, that already I hear them.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
25 E quei: «S’i’ fossi di piombato vetro, 26 l’imagine di fuor tua non trarrei 27 più tosto a me, che quella dentro ’mpetro.
query.result: 25 And he: “If I were of leaded glass, 26 the image from outside yours I would not draw 27 more quickly to me, than that within I engrave.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
28 Pur mo venieno i tuo’ pensier tra ’ miei, 29 con simile atto e con simile faccia, 30 sì che d’intrambi un sol consiglio fei.
query.result: 28 Now your thoughts came among mine, 29 with similar act and with similar face, 30 so that of both one single counsel he made.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
31 S’elli è che sì la destra costa giaccia, 32 che noi possiam ne l’altra bolgia scendere, 33 noi fuggirem l’imaginata caccia».
query.result: 31 If it is that so the right bank lies, 32 that we may into the other bolgia descend, 33 we will flee the imagined hunt.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
34 Già non compié di tal consiglio rendere, 35 ch’io li vidi venir con l’ali tese 36 non molto lungi, per volerne prendere.
query.result: 34 Already he did not complete of such counsel to give, 35 that I saw them come with wings extended 36 not far off, to want to seize us.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
37 Lo duca mio di sùbito mi prese, 38 come la madre ch’al romore è desta 39 e vede presso a sé le fiamme accese,
40 che prende il figlio e fugge e non s’arresta, 41 avendo più di lui che di sé cura, 42 tanto che solo una camiscia vesta;
43 e giù dal collo de la ripa dura 44 supin si diede a la pendente roccia, 45 che l’un de’ lati a l’altra bolgia tura.

Please translate each line literally into English.
46 Non corse mai sì tosto acqua per doccia 47 a volger ruota di molin terragno, 48 quand’ ella più verso le pale approccia,
49 come ’l maestro mio per quel vivagno, 50 portandosene me sovra ’l suo petto, 51 come suo figlio, non come compagno.
query.result:
46 Never ran water so quickly through a channel 47 to turn the wheel of a land mill, 48 when it approaches more towards the paddles,
49 as my master through that living stream, 50 carrying me over his chest, 51 like his son, not like a companion.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
52 A pena fuoro i piè suoi giunti al letto 53 del fondo giù, ch’e’ furon in sul colle 54 sovresso noi; ma non lì era sospetto:
55 ché l’alta provedenza che lor volle 56 porre ministri de la fossa quinta, 57 poder di partirs’ indi a tutti tolle.
query.result:
52 Hardly were his feet joined to the bed 53 of the bottom down, when they were upon the hill 54 above us; but there was no suspicion there:
55 because the high providence that willed to them 56 to place ministers of the fifth ditch, 57 power to depart from there to all took away.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
58 Là giù trovammo una gente dipinta 59 che giva intorno assai con lenti passi, 60 piangendo e nel sembiante stanca e vinta.
query.result: 58 Down there we found a people painted 59 who went around much with slow steps, 60 weeping and in appearance tired and defeated.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
61 Elli avean cappe con cappucci bassi 62 dinanzi a li occhi, fatte de la taglia 63 che in Clugnì per li monaci fassi.
query.result: 61 They had capes with low hoods 62 before the eyes, made of the cut 63 that in Cluny for the monks is made.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
64 Di fuor dorate son, sì ch’elli abbaglia; 65 ma dentro tutte piombo, e gravi tanto, 66 che Federigo le mettea di paglia.

query.result:
67 Oh, eternally laborious cloak! 68 We turned ourselves also still to the left 69 with them together, intent on the sad weeping;
70 but because of the weight that tired people 71 came so slowly, that we were new 72 to the company at every movement of the hip.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
73 Per ch’io al duca mio: «Fa che tu trovi 74 alcun ch’al fatto o al nome si conosca, 75 e li occhi, sì andando, intorno movi».
query.result: 73 For which I to my duke: “Make that you find 74 someone who to the fact or to the name is known, 75 and the eyes, so going, move around.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
76 E un che ’ntese la parola tosca, 77 di retro a noi gridò: «Tenete i piedi, 78 voi che correte sì per l’aura fosca!
79 Forse ch’avrai da me quel che tu chiedi».
query.result:
76 And one who heard the Tuscan word, 77 from behind us cried: “Hold your feet, 78 you who run so through the dark air!
79 Perhaps you will have from me what you ask.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
80 Onde ’l duca si volse e disse: «Aspetta, 81 e poi secondo il suo passo procedi».
82 Ristetti, e vidi due mostrar gran fretta 83 de l’animo, col viso, d’esser meco; 84 ma tardavali ’l carco e la via stretta.
query.result:
80 Whereupon the duke turned and said: “Wait, 81 and then according to his pace proceed.”
82 I remained still, and I saw two show great haste 83 of the soul, with the face, to be with me; 84 but the burden and the narrow way delayed them.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
85 Quando fuor giunti, assai con l’occhio bieco 86 mi rimiraron sanza far parola; 87 poi si volsero in sé, e dicean seco:
88 «Costui par vivo a l’atto de la gola; 89 e s’e’ son morti, per qual privilegio 90 vanno scoperti de la grave stola?».

Please translate each line literally into English.
91 Poi disser me: «O Tosco, ch’al collegio 92 de l’ipocriti tristi se’ venuto, 93 dir chi tu se’ non avere in dispregio».
query.result: 91 Then he said to me: “O Tuscan, who to the college 92 of the sorrowful hypocrites have you come, 93 say who you are, do not have it in contempt.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
94 E io a loro: «I’ fui nato e cresciuto 95 sovra ’l bel fiume d’Arno a la gran villa, 96 e son col corpo ch’i’ ho sempre avuto.
query.result: 94 And I to them: “I was born and raised 95 above the beautiful river Arno, at the great villa, 96 and am with the body that I have always had.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
97 Ma voi chi siete, a cui tanto distilla 98 quant’ i’ veggio dolor giù per le guance? 99 e che pena è in voi che sì sfavilla?».
query.result: 97 But you who are you, to whom so much distills 98 as I see sorrow down the cheeks? 99 and what pain is in you that so sparkles?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
100 E l’un rispuose a me: «Le cappe rance 101 son di piombo sì grosse, che li pesi 102 fan così cigolar le lor bilance.
query.result: 100 And one responded to me: “The rusty capes 101 are of lead so thick, that the weights 102 make their balances thus creak.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
103 Frati godenti fummo, e bolognesi; 104 io Catalano e questi Loderingo 105 nomati, e da tua terra insieme presi
106 come suole esser tolto un uom solingo, 107 per conservar sua pace; e fummo tali, 108 ch’ancor si pare intorno dal Gardingo».
query.result:
103 We were joyful friars, and Bolognese; 104 I Catalano and this Loderingo 105 named, and from your land together taken
106 as it is wont to be taken a solitary man, 107 to preserve his peace; and we were such, 108 that still it seems around from Gardingo.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
109 Io cominciai: «O frati, i vostri mali . . . »; 110 ma più non dissi, ch’a l’occhio mi corse 111 un, crucifisso in terra con tre pali.

Please translate each line literally into English.
112 Quando mi vide, tutto si distorse, 113 soffiando ne la barba con sospiri; 114 e ’l frate Catalan, ch’a ciò s’accorse,
115 mi disse: «Quel confitto che tu miri, 116 consigliò i Farisei che convenia 117 porre un uom per lo popolo a’ martìri.
query.result:
112 When he saw me, all distorted himself, 113 blowing in the beard with sighs; 114 and the friar Catalano, who noticed this,
115 said to me: “That afflicted one that you see, 116 advised the Pharisees that it was necessary 117 to put a man for the people to martyrdom.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
118 Attraversato è, nudo, ne la via, 119 come tu vedi, ed è mestier ch’el senta 120 qualunque passa, come pesa, pria.
query.result: 118 He is crossed, naked, in the street, 119 as you see, and it is necessary that he feels 120 whoever passes, as he weighs, before.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
121 E a tal modo il socero si stenta 122 in questa fossa, e li altri dal concilio 123 che fu per li Giudei mala sementa».
query.result: 121 And in such a way the father-in-law strains 122 in this ditch, and the others from the council 123 that was for the Jews a bad seed.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
124 Allor vid’ io maravigliar Virgilio 125 sovra colui ch’era disteso in croce 126 tanto vilmente ne l’etterno essilio.
query.result: 124 Then I saw Virgil marvel 125 over the one who was stretched on the cross 126 so vilely in the eternal exile.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
127 Poscia drizzò al frate cotal voce: 128 «Non vi dispiaccia, se vi lece, dirci 129 s’a la man destra giace alcuna foce
130 onde noi amendue possiamo uscirci, 131 sanza costrigner de li angeli neri 132 che vegnan d’esto fondo a dipartirci».
query.result:
127 Afterwards he directed such a voice to the friar: 128 “Do not be displeased, if it pleases you, to tell us 129 if to the right hand lies any opening
130 so that we both can exit from it, 131 without compelling the black angels 132 who come from this bottom to separate us.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
133 Rispuose adunque: «Più che tu non speri 134 s’appressa un sasso che da la gran cerchia 135 si move e varca tutt’ i vallon feri,
136 salvo che ’n questo è rotto e nol coperchia; 137 montar potrete su per la ruina, 138 che giace in costa e nel fondo soperchia».
query.result:
133 He answered then: “More than you hope 134 is near a stone that from the great circle 135 moves and crosses all the fierce valleys,
136 save that in this it is broken and does not cover it; 137 you will be able to climb up onto the ruin, 138 that lies on the slope and covers the bottom.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
139 Lo duca stette un poco a testa china; 140 poi disse: «Mal contava la bisogna 141 colui che i peccator di qua uncina».

Please translate each line literally into English.
142 E ’l frate: «Io udi’ già dire a Bologna 143 del diavol vizi assai, tra ’ quali udi’ 144 ch’elli è bugiardo, e padre di menzogna».
query.result: 142 And the friar: “I already heard tell in Bologna 143 of the devil’s vices enough, among which I heard 144 that he is a liar, and father of lies.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
145 Appresso il duca a gran passi sen gì, 146 turbato un poco d’ira nel sembiante; 147 ond’ io da li ’ncarcati mi parti’
148 dietro a le poste de le care piante.
query.result:
145 Afterwards the leader went with great steps, 146 disturbed a little with anger in his appearance; 147 from which I, from the burdened ones, departed
148 behind the ranks of the beloved plants.
